titlestmt.titleproper: Finding aid for the Norman W. Price diary-ledger

profiledesc.creation: Encoded finding aid created from MARC record by Dallas Pillen
profiledesc.langusage: The finding aid is written in English

descgrp.accessrestrict: The collection is open for research use.

archdesc.bioghist: A native of Canada, Price was a student at the University of Michigan 1890-1894 and earned a medical degree from the University of Toronto in 1896.
archdesc.scopecontent: Minute book used by Price to record course notes, writings, accounts and expenses, a record of patients treated 1895-1897 and a general diary of events covering 1888-1890 relating to his life in Canada, mostly in Napanee, his work in schools, agriculture, townspeople and his first year as a student in Ann Arbor, Michigan.
